item.title: Formulae
item.description: Profitability # Ratio Formula Meaning Judgment Criteria ROSF (%) = NP / Equity * 100 $\frac{NP}{\text{Equity}} \times 100$ Measures how much profit is generated from shareholders’ equity. Higher values indicate better performance. ROCE (%) = PBIT / CE * 100 $\frac{PBIT}{\text{CE}} \times 100$ Indicates how well the company is using its capital to generate profit. Higher values are preferable, showing efficient use of capital. Operating profit margin (%) = PBIT / SR * 100 $\frac{PBIT}{\text{SR}} \times 100$ Shows the percentage of sales that has turned into profits.
